activities.name: LookupPartitionList
activities.description: Lookup activity to retrieve the partition list which has not been copied to Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 from an external control table.

source.sqlReaderQuery: SELECT PartitionPrefix FROM s3_partition_control_table WHERE SuccessOrFailure = 0

activities.name: ForEachFolderList
activities.description: ForEach activity to get the partition list from the Lookup activity and iterates each partition to the TriggerCopy pipeline. You can set the batchCount to run multiple ADF copy jobs concurrently.

activities.name: TriggerCopy
activities.description: ExecutePipeline activity to execute TriggerCopy pipeline. The reason we create another pipeline to make each copy job copy a parition is because it will make you easy to rerun the failed copy job to reload that specific partition again from AWS S3. All other copy jobs loading other partitions will not be impacted.

properties.description:
Copy huge amount of data in bulk from database using external control table to store source table list with partitions for each table.

When you want to migrate data from your Azure Synapse Analytics like Oracle server, Netezza server, Teradata server or SQL Server to Azure, you have to load huge amount of data from multiple tables in data sources. In most cases, data has to be further partitioned in each table so that you can load rows with multiple threads in parallel from single table.

activities.name: GetPartitionList
activities.description: Lookup activity to retrieve the list of partitions stored in the external control table.

sqlReaderQuery.value: select @{pipeline().parameters.Control_Table_Schema_PartitionID} as PartitionID, @{pipeline().parameters.Control_Table_Schema_SourceTableName} as SourceTableName, @{pipeline().parameters.Control_Table_Schema_FilterQuery} as FilterQuery from @{pipeline().parameters.Control_Table_Name}

activities.name: ForEachPartition
activities.description: ForEach activity to get the partition list from Lookup activity and then iterate each of them to Copy activity.

activities.name: CopyOnePartition
activities.description: Copy activity to copy each partition from source database store to destination store.

properties.description: You can input the connection to your AWS S3 as the data source store.
Connection to your data destination store.
Connection to your data source store.
You can input the connection to your Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 as the data destination store.
Connect to your data destination store.
Connect to your data source store.
You can input the connection to your external control table which is used to store the partition list for AWS S3.
The external control table is used to store the partition list of data source tables.

typeProperties.script:
source(output(
		EmployeeKey as integer,
		ParentEmployeeKey as integer,
		EmployeeNationalIDAlternateKey as string,
		ParentEmployeeNationalIDAlternateKey as string,
		SalesTerritoryKey as integer,
		FirstName as string,
		LastName as string,
		MiddleName as string,
		NameStyle as boolean,
		Title as string,
		HireDate as date,
		BirthDate as date,
		LoginID as string,
		EmailAddress as string,
		Phone as string,
		MaritalStatus as string,
		EmergencyContactName as string,
		EmergencyContactPhone as string,
		SalariedFlag as boolean,
		Gender as string,
		PayFrequency as integer,
		BaseRate as decimal(19,4),
		VacationHours as integer,
		SickLeaveHours as integer,
		CurrentFlag as boolean,
		SalesPersonFlag as boolean,
		DepartmentName as string,
		StartDate as date,
		EndDate as date,
		Status as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	isolationLevel: 'READ_UNCOMMITTED',
	format: 'table',
	staged: false) ~> PrivateSynapseTable
PrivateSynapseTable sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> PrivateBlobOutput
PrivateSynapseTable sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	input(
		store_id as integer,
		store_name as string,
		phone as string,
		email as string,
		street as string,
		city as string,
		state as string,
		zip_code as string
	),
	deletable:false,
	insertable:true,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:false,
	recreate:true,
	format: 'table',
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	errorHandlingOption: 'stopOnFirstError') ~> PrivateSQlMIDestination

source(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	format: 'delimited',
	container: 'adfsecureblob',
	folderPath: 'samples',
	fileName: 'moviesDB.csv',
	columnDelimiter: ',',
	escapeChar: '\\',
	quoteChar: '\"',
	columnNamesAsHeader: false) ~> source1
source1 sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	input(
		EmployeeKey as integer,
		ParentEmployeeKey as integer,
		EmployeeNationalIDAlternateKey as string,
		ParentEmployeeNationalIDAlternateKey as string,
		SalesTerritoryKey as integer,
		FirstName as string,
		LastName as string,
		MiddleName as string,
		NameStyle as boolean,
		Title as string,
		HireDate as date,
		BirthDate as date,
		LoginID as string,
		EmailAddress as string,
		Phone as string,
		MaritalStatus as string,
		EmergencyContactName as string,
		EmergencyContactPhone as string,
		SalariedFlag as boolean,
		Gender as string,
		PayFrequency as integer,
		BaseRate as decimal(19,4),
		VacationHours as integer,
		SickLeaveHours as integer,
		CurrentFlag as boolean,
		SalesPersonFlag as boolean,
		DepartmentName as string,
		StartDate as date,
		EndDate as date,
		Status as string
	),
	deletable:false,
	insertable:true,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:false,
	format: 'table',
	staged: true,
	allowCopyCommand: true,
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	errorHandlingOption: 'stopOnFirstError') ~> sink1
